newsitem.title: ITALY: Italian shares end higher but activity low.
newsitem.headline: Italian shares end higher but activity low.

text.p: The Italian stock market inched up to close firm but with activity subdued and volumes reduced in holiday-thinned trade on Friday.

The market woke up slightly after U.S. jobs data released during the afternoon session and roused itself from lethargy with the blue-chip Mib30 index ending 0.6 percent up at 18399 and the all-share Mibtel index 0.63 percent stronger at 12354.
Many players took Friday off, extending Thursday's public holiday into a long weekend and dealers said the reduced volume had exaggerated moves.
They said the only real action was in ever popular telecoms stocks while otherwise "sellers met no bids and vice versa."
State mobile phone service operator Telecom Italia Mobile (TIM) forged a new high at 5455 earlier in the session before ending up 0.32 percent on the day at 5388.
State telecom operator Telecom Italia climbed 2.1 percent to 4628 while state telecom holding Stet, with which it is set to merge in July, ended 1.03 percent up at 8210.
Blue chip carmaker Fiat closed 0.78 percent up at 5704 while state-controlled energy giant Eni ended 0.24 percent lower at 8695.
